title: 詩經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

chapters.title: Odes Of Zhou And The South

passages.zh: 關關雎鳩、在河之洲。窈窕淑女、君子好逑。
passages.en: Guan-guan go the ospreys,On the islet in the river.The modest, retiring, virtuous, young lady:For our prince a good mate she.

passages.zh: 參差荇菜、左右流之。窈窕淑女、寤寐求之。求之不得、寤寐思服。悠哉悠哉、輾轉反側。
passages.en: Here long, there short, is the duckweed,To the left, to the right, borne about by the current.The modest, retiring, virtuous, young lady:Waking and sleeping, he sought her.He sought her and found her not,And waking and sleeping he thought about her.Long he thought; oh! long and anxiously;On his side, on his back, he turned, and back again.

passages.zh: 參差荇菜、左右采之。窈窕淑女、琴瑟友之。參差荇菜、左右芼之。窈窕淑女、鍾鼓樂之。
passages.en: Here long, there short, is the duckweed;On the left, on the right, we gather it.The modest, retiring, virtuous, young lady:With lutes, small and large, let us give her friendly welcome.Here long, there short, is the duckweed;On the left, on the right, we cook and present it.The modest, retiring, virtuous, young lady:With bells and drums let us show our delight in her.

passages.zh: 葛之覃兮、施于中谷。維葉萋萋、黃鳥于飛。集于灌木、其鳴喈喈。
passages.en: How the dolichos spread itself out,Extending to the middle of the valley!Its leaves were luxuriant;The yellow birds flew about,And collected on the thickly growing trees,Their pleasant notes resounding far.

passages.zh: 葛之覃兮、施于中谷。維葉莫莫、是刈是濩。為絺為綌、服之無斁。
passages.en: How the dolichos spread itself out,Extending to the middle of the valley!Its leaves were luxuriant and dense.I cut it and I boiled it,And made both fine cloth and coarse,Which I will wear without getting tired of it.

passages.zh: 言告師氏、言告言歸。薄污我私、薄澣我衣。害澣害否、歸寧父母 。
passages.en: I have told the matron,Who will announce that I am going to see my parents.I will wash my private clothes clean,And I will rinse my robes.Which need to be rinsed, which do not?I am going back to visit my parents.

passages.zh: 采采卷耳、不盈頃筐。嗟我懷人、寘彼周行。
passages.en: I was gathering and gathering the mouse-ear,But could not fill my shallow basket.With a sigh for the man of my heart,I placed it there on the highway.

passages.zh: 陟彼崔嵬、我馬虺隤。我姑酌彼金罍、維以不永懷。
passages.en: I was ascending that rock-covered height,But my horses were too tired to breast it.I will now pour a cup from that gilded vase,Hoping I may not have to think of him long.

passages.zh: 陟彼高岡、我馬玄黃。我姑酌彼兕觥、維以不永傷。
passages.en: I was ascending that lofty ridge,But my horses turned of a dark yellow.I will now take a cup from that rhinoceros' horn,Hoping I may not have long to sorrow.

passages.zh: 陟彼砠矣、我馬瘏矣、我僕痡矣、云何吁矣。
passages.en: I was ascending that flat-topped height,But my horses became quite disabled,And my servants were [also] disabled.Oh! how great is my sorrow!

passages.zh: 南有樛木、葛藟纍之。樂只君子、福履綏之。
passages.en: In the south are the trees with curved drooping branches,With the doliches creepers clinging to them.To be rejoiced in is our princely lady:May she repose in her happiness and dignity!

passages.zh: 南有樛木、葛藟荒之。樂只君子、福履將之。
passages.en: In the south are the trees with curved drooping branches,Covered by the dolichos creepers.To be rejoiced in is our princely lady:May she be great in her happiness and dignity!

passages.zh: 南有樛木、葛藟縈之。樂只君子、福履成之。
passages.en: In the south are the trees with curved drooping branches,Round which the dolichos creepers twine.To be rejoiced in is our princely lady:May she be complete in her happiness and dignity!

passages.zh: 螽斯羽、詵詵兮。宜爾子孫、振振兮。
passages.en: Ye locusts, winged tribes,How harmoniously you collect together!Right is it that your descendantsShould be multitudinous!

passages.zh: 螽斯羽、薨薨兮。宜爾子孫、繩繩兮。
passages.en: Ye locusts, winged tribes,How sound your wings in flight!Right is it that your descendentsShould be as in unbroken strings!

passages.zh: 螽斯羽、揖揖兮。宜爾子孫、蟄蟄兮。
passages.en: Ye locusts, winged tribes,How you cluster together!Right is it that your descendentsShould be in swarms!

passages.zh: 桃之夭夭、灼灼其華。之子于歸、宜其室家。
passages.en: The peach tree is young and elegant;Brilliant are its flowers.This young lady is going to her future home,And will order well her chamber and house.

passages.zh: 桃之夭夭、有蕡其實。之子于歸、宜其家室。
passages.en: The peach tree is young and elegant;Abundant will be its fruits.This young lady is going to her future home,And will order well her house and chamber.

passages.zh: 桃之夭夭、其葉蓁蓁。之子于歸、宜其家人。
passages.en: The peach tree is young and elegant;Luxuriant are its leaves.This young lady is going to her future home,And will order well her family.

passages.zh: 肅肅兔罝、椓之丁丁。赳赳武夫、公侯干城。
passages.en: Carefully adjusted are the rabbit nets;Clang clang go the blows on the pegs.That stalwart, martial manMight be shield and wall to his prince.

passages.zh: 肅肅兔罝、施于中逵。赳赳武夫、公侯好仇。
passages.en: Carefully adjusted are the rabbit nets,And placed where many ways meet.That stalwart, martial manWould be a good companion for his prince.

passages.zh: 肅肅兔罝、施于中林。赳赳武夫、公侯腹心。
passages.en: Carefully adjusted are the rabbit nets,And placed in the midst of the forest.That stalwart, martial manMight be head and heart to his prince.

passages.zh: 采采芣苢、薄言采之。采采芣苢、薄言有之。
passages.en: We gather and gather the plantains;Now we may gather them.We gather and gather the plantains;Now we have got them.

passages.zh: 采采芣苢、薄言掇之。采采芣苢、薄言捋之。
passages.en: We gather and gather the plantains;Now we pluck the ears.We gather and gather the plantains;Now we rub out the seeds.

passages.zh: 采采芣苢、薄言袺之。采采芣苢、薄言襭之。
passages.en: We gather and gather the plantains;Now we place the seeds in our skirts.We gather and gather the plantains;Now we tuck out skirts under our girdles.

passages.zh: 南有喬木、不可休息。漢有游女、不可求思。漢之廣矣、不可泳思。江之永矣、不可方思。
passages.en: In the south rise the trees without branches,Affording no shelter.By the Han are girls rambling about,But it is vain to solicit them.The breadth of the HanCannot be dived across;The length of the JiangCannot be navigated with a raft.

passages.zh: 翹翹錯薪、言刈其楚。之子于歸、言秣其馬。漢之廣矣、不可泳思。江之永矣、不可方思。
passages.en: Many are the bundles of firewood;I would cut down the thorns [to form more].Those girls that are going to their future home, -I would feed their horses.The breadth of the HanCannot be dived across;The length of the Jiang,Cannot be navigated with a raft.

passages.zh: 翹翹錯薪、言刈其蔞 。之子于歸、言秣其駒 。漢之廣矣、不可泳思 。江之永矣、不可方思 。
passages.en: Many are the bundles of firewood;I would cut down the southern wood [to form more].Those girls that are going to their future home, -I would feed their colts.The breadth of the HanCannot be dived across;The length of the JiangCannot be navigated with a raft.

passages.zh: 遵彼汝墳、伐其條枚。未見君子、惄如調飢。
passages.en: Along those raised banks of the Ru,I cut down the branches and slender stems.While I could not see my lord,I felt as it were pangs of great hunger.

passages.zh: 遵彼汝墳、伐其條肄。既見君子、不我遐棄。
passages.en: Along those raised banks of the Ru,I cut down the branches and fresh twigs.I have seen my lord;He has not cast me away.

passages.zh: 魴魚赬尾、王室如燬 。雖則如燬、父母孔邇 。
passages.en: The bream is showing its tail all red;The royal House is like a blazing fire.Though it be like a blazing fire,Your parents are very near.

passages.zh: 麟之趾、振振公子。于嗟麟兮。
passages.en: The feet of the Lin:The noble sons of our prince,Ah! they are the Lin!

passages.zh: 麟之定、振振公姓。于嗟麟兮。
passages.en: The forehead of the Lin:The noble grandsons of our prince,Ah! they are the Lin!

passages.zh: 麟之角、振振公族。于嗟麟兮。
passages.en: The horn of the Lin:The noble kindred of our prince,Ah! they are the Lin!

chapters.title: Odes Of Shao And The South

passages.zh: 維鵲有巢、維鳩居之。之子于歸、百兩御之。
passages.en: The nest is the magpie's;The dove dwells in it.This young lady is going to her future home;A hundred carriages are meeting her.

passages.zh: 維鵲有巢、維鳩方之。之子于歸、百兩將之。
passages.en: The nest is the magpie's;The dove possesses it.This young lady is going to her future home;A hundred carriages are escorting her.

passages.zh: 維鵲有巢、維鳩盈之。之子于歸、百兩成之。
passages.en: The nest is the magpie's;The dove fills it.This young lady is going to her future home;These hundreds of carriages complete her array.

passages.zh: 于以采蘩、于沼于沚。于以用之、公侯之事。
passages.en: She gathers the white southernwood,By the ponds, on the islets.She employs it,In the business of our prince.

passages.zh: 于以采蘩、于㵎之中。于以用之、公侯之宮。
passages.en: She gathers the white southernwood,Along the streams in the valleys.She employs it,In the temple of our prince.

passages.zh: 被之僮僮、夙夜在公。被之祁祁、薄言還歸。
passages.en: With head-dress reverently rising aloft,Early, while yet it is night, she is in the prince's temple;In her dead-dress, slowly retiring,She returns to her own apartments.

passages.zh: 喓喓草蟲、趯趯阜螽未見君子、憂心忡忡。亦既見止、亦既覯止、我心則降。
passages.en: Yao-yao went the grass-insects,And the hoppers sprang about.While I do not see my lord,My sorrowful heart is agitated.Let me have seen him,Let me have met him,And my heart will then be stilled.

passages.zh: 陟彼南山、言采其蕨。未見君子、憂心惙惙。亦既見止、亦既覯止、我心則說。
passages.en: I ascended that hill in the south,And gathered the turtle-foot ferns.While I do not see my lord,My sorrowful heart is very sad.Let me have seen him,Let me have met him,And my heart will then be pleased.

passages.zh: 陟彼南山、言采其薇。未見君子、我心傷悲。亦既見止、亦既覯止、我心則夷。
passages.en: I ascended that hill in the south,And gathered the thorn-ferns.While I do not see my lord,My sorrowful heart is wounded with grief.Let me have seen him,Let me have met him,And my heart will then be at peace.

passages.zh: 于以采蘋、南㵎之濱。于以采藻、于彼行潦。
passages.en: She gathers the large duckweed,By the banks of the stream in the southern valley.She gathers the pondweed,In those pools left by the floods.

passages.zh: 于以盛之、維筐及筥。于以湘之、維錡及釜。
passages.en: She deposits what she gathers,In her square baskets and round onesShe boils it,In her tripods and pans.

passages.zh: 于以奠之、宗室牖下。誰其尸之、有齊季女。
passages.en: She sets forth her preparations,Under the window in the ancestral chamber.Who superintends the business?It is [this] reverent young lady.

passages.zh: 蔽芾甘棠、勿翦勿伐、召伯所茇。
passages.en: [This] umbrageous sweet pear-tree; -Clip it not, hew it not down.Under it the chief of Shao lodged.

passages.zh: 蔽芾甘棠、勿翦勿敗、召伯所憩。
passages.en: [This] umbrageous sweet pear-tree; -Clip it not, break not a twig of it.Under it the chief of Shao rested.

passages.zh: 蔽芾甘棠、勿翦勿拜、召伯所說。
passages.en: [This] umbrageous sweet pear-tree; -Clip it not, bend not a twig of it.Under it the chief of Shao halted.

passages.zh: 厭浥行露、豈不夙夜、謂行多露。
passages.en: Wet lay the dew on the path:Might I not [have walked there] in the early dawn?But I said there was [too] much dew on the path.

passages.zh: 誰謂雀無角、何以穿我屋。誰謂女無家、何以速我獄。雖速我獄、室家不足。
passages.en: Who can say the sparrow has no horn?How else could it bore through my house?Who can say that you did not get me betrothed?How else could you have urged on this trial?But though you have forced me to trial,Your ceremonies for betrothal were not sufficient.

passages.zh: 誰謂鼠無牙、何以穿我墉。誰謂女無家、何以速我訟。雖速我訟、亦不女從。
passages.en: Who can say that the rat has no molar teeth?How else could it bore through my wall?Who can say that you did not get me betrothed?How else could you have urged on this trial?But though you have forced me to trial,I will still not follow you.

passages.zh: 羔羊之皮、素絲五紽。退食自公、委蛇委蛇。
passages.en: [Those] lamb-skins and sheep-skins,With their five braidings of white silk!They have retired from the court to take their their meal;Easy are they and self-possesed.

passages.zh: 羔羊之革、素絲五緎。委蛇委蛇、自公退食。
passages.en: [Those] lamb-skins and sheep-skins,With their five seams wrought with white silk!Easy are they and self-possessed;They have retired from the court to take their their meal.

passages.zh: 羔羊之縫、素絲五總。委蛇委蛇、退食自公。
passages.en: The seams of [those] lamb-skins and sheep-skins,The five joinings wrought with white silk!Easy are they and self-possessed;They have retired to take their their meal from the court.

passages.zh: 殷其靁、在南山之陽。何斯違斯、莫敢或遑。振振君子、歸哉歸哉。
passages.en: Grandly rolls the thunder,On the south of the southern hill!How was it he went away from this,Not daring to take a little rest?My noble lord!May he return! May he return!

passages.zh: 殷其靁、在南山之側。何斯違斯、莫敢遑息。振振君子、歸哉歸哉。
passages.en: Grandly rolls the thunder,About the sides of the southern hill!How was it he went away from this,Not daring to take a little rest?My noble lord!May he return! May he return!

passages.zh: 殷其靁、在南山之下。何斯違斯、莫或遑處。振振君子、歸哉歸哉。
passages.en: Grandly rolls the thunder,At the foot of the southern hill!How was it he went away from this,Not remaining a little at rest?My noble lord!May he return! May he return!

passages.zh: 摽有梅、其實七兮。求我庶士、迨其吉兮。
passages.en: Dropping are the fruits from the plum-tree;There are [but] seven [tenths] of them left!For the gentlemen who seek me,This is the fortunate time!

passages.zh: 摽有梅、其實三兮。求我庶士、迨其今兮。
passages.en: Dropping are the fruits from the plum-tree;There are [but] three [tenths] of them left!For the gentlemen who seek me,Now is the time.

passages.zh: 摽有梅、頃筐塈之。求我庶士、迨其謂之。
passages.en: Dropt are the fruits from the plum-tree;In my shallow basket I have collected them.Would the gentlemen who seek me[Only] speak about it!

passages.zh: 嘒彼小星、三五在東。肅肅宵征、夙夜在公、寔命不同。
passages.en: Small are those starlets,Three or five of them in the east,Swiftly by night we go;In the early dawn we are with the prince.Our lot is not like hers.

passages.zh: 嘒彼小星、維參與昴。肅肅宵征、抱衾與裯、寔命不猶。
passages.en: Small are those starlets,And there are Orion and the Pleiades.Swiftly by night we go,Carrying our coverlets and sheets.Our lot is not like hers.

passages.zh: 江有汜、之子歸、不我以。不我以、其後也悔。
passages.en: The Jiang has its branches, led from it and returning to it.Our lady, when she was married,Would not employ us.She would not employ us;But afterwards she repented.

passages.zh: 江有渚、之子歸、不我與。不我與、其後也處。
passages.en: The Jiang has its islets.Our lady, when she was married,Would not let us be with her.She would not let us be with her;But afterwards she repressed [such feelings].

passages.zh: 江有沱、之子歸、不我過。不我過、其嘯也歌。
passages.en: The Jiang has the Tuo.Our lady, when she was married,Would not come near usShe would not come near us;But she blew that feeling away, and sang.

passages.zh: 野有死麕、白茅包之。有女懷春、吉士誘之。
passages.en: In the wild there is a dead antelope,And it is wrapped up with the white grass.There is a young lady with thoughts natural to the spring,And a fine gentleman would lead her astray.

passages.zh: 林有樸樕、野有死鹿。白茅純束、有女如玉。
passages.en: In the forest there are the scrubby oaks;In the wild there is a dead deer,And it is bound round with the white grass.There is a young lady like a gem.

passages.zh: 舒而脫脫兮、無感我帨兮、無使尨也吠。
passages.en: [She says], Slowly; gently, gently;Do not move my handkerchief;Do not make my dog bark.

passages.zh: 何彼襛矣、唐棣之華。曷不肅雝、王姬之車。
passages.en: How great is that luxuriance,Those flowers of the sparrow-plum!Are they not expressive of reverence and harmony, -The carriages of the king's daughter?

passages.zh: 何彼襛矣、華如桃李。平王之孫、齊侯之子。
passages.en: How great is that luxuriance,The flowers like those of the peach-tree or the plum![See] the grand-daughter of the tranquillizing king,And the son of the reverent marquis!

passages.zh: 其釣維何、維絲伊緡。齊侯之子、平王之孫。
passages.en: What are used in angling?Silk threads formed into lines.The son of the reverent marquis,And the grand-daughter of the tranquillizing king!

passages.zh: 彼茁者葭、壹發五豝。于嗟乎騶虞。
passages.en: Strong and abundant grow the rushes;He discharges [but] one arrow at five wild boars.Ah! he is the Zou-yu!

passages.zh: 彼茁者蓬、壹發五豵。于嗟乎騶虞。
passages.en: Strong and abundant grow the artemisia;He discharges [but] one arrow at five wild boars.Ah! he is the Zou-yu!

passages.zh: 汎彼柏舟、亦汎其流。耿耿不寐、如有隱憂。微我無酒、以敖以遊。
passages.en: It floats about, that boat of cypress wood;Yea, it floats about on the current.Disturbed am I and sleepless,As if suffering from a painful wound.It is not because I have no wine,And that I might not wander and saunder about.

passages.zh: 我心匪鑒、不可以茹。亦有兄弟、不可以據。薄言往愬、逢彼之怒。
passages.en: My mind is not a mirror; -It cannot [equally] receive [all impressions].I, indeed, have brothers,But I cannot depend on them,I meet with their anger.

passages.zh: 我心匪石、不可轉也。我心匪席、不可卷也。威儀棣棣、不可選也。
passages.en: My mind is not a stone; -It cannot be rolled about.My mind is not a mat; -It cannot be rolled up.My deportment has been dignified and good,With nothing wrong which can be pointed out.

passages.zh: 憂心悄悄、慍于群小。覯閔既多、受侮不少。靜言思之、寤辟有摽。
passages.en: My anxious heart is full of trouble;I am hated by the herd of mean creatures;I meet with many distresses;I receive insults not a few.Silently I think of my case,And, starting as from sleep, I beat my breast.

passages.zh: 日居月諸、胡迭而微。心之憂矣、如匪澣衣。靜言思之、不能奮飛。
passages.en: There are the sun and moon, -How is it that the former has become small, and not the latter?The sorrow cleaves to my heart,Like an unwashed dress.Silently I think of my case,But I cannot spread my wings and fly away.

passages.zh: 綠兮衣兮、綠衣黃裏。心之憂矣、曷維其已。
passages.en: Green is the upper robe,Green with a yellow lining!The sorrow of my heart, -How can it cease?

passages.zh: 綠兮衣兮、綠衣黃裳。心之憂矣、曷維其亡。
passages.en: Green is the upper robe,Green the upper, and yellow the lower garment!The sorrow of my heart, -How can it be forgotten?

passages.zh: 綠兮絲兮、女所治兮。我思古人、俾無訧兮。
passages.en: [Dyed] green has been the silk; -It was you who did it.[But] I think of the ancients,That I may be kept from doing wrong.

passages.zh: 絺兮綌兮、淒其以風。我思古人、實獲我心。
passages.en: Linen, fine or coarse,Is cold when worn in the wind.I think of the ancients,And find what is in my heart.

passages.zh: 燕燕于飛、差池其羽。之子于歸、遠送于野。瞻望弗及、泣涕如雨。
passages.en: The swallows go flying about,With their wings unevenly displayed.The lady was returning [to her native state],And I escorted her far into the country.I looked till I could no longer see her,And my tears fell down like rain.

passages.zh: 燕燕于飛、頡之頏之。之子于歸、遠于將之。瞻望弗及、佇立以泣。
passages.en: The swallows go flying about,Now up, now down.The lady was returning [to her native state],And far did I accompany her.I looked till I could no longer see her,And long I stood and wept.

passages.zh: 燕燕于飛、下上其音。之子于歸、遠送于南。瞻望弗及、實勞我心。
passages.en: The swallows go flying about;From below, from above, comes their twittering.The lady was returning [to her native state],And far did I escort her to the south.I looked till I could no longer see her,And great was the grief of my heart.

passages.zh: 仲氏任只、其心塞淵。終溫且惠、淑慎其身。先君之思、以勗寡人。
passages.en: Lovingly confiding was lady Zhong;Truly deep was her feeling.Both gentle was she and docile,Virtuously careful of her person.In thinking of our deceased lord,She stimulated worthless me.

passages.zh: 日居月諸、照臨下土。乃如之人兮、逝不古處。胡能有定、寧不我顧。
passages.en: O sun; O moon,Which enlighten this lower earth!Here is the man,Who treats me not according to the ancient rule.How can he get his mind settled?Would he then not regard me?

passages.zh: 日居月諸、下土是冒。乃如之人兮、逝不相好。胡能有定、寧不我報。
passages.en: O sun; O moon,Which overshadow this lower earth!Here is this man,Who will not be friendly with me.How can he get his mind settled?Would he then not respond to me?

passages.zh: 日居月諸、出自東方。乃如之人兮、德音無良。胡能有定、俾也可忘。
passages.en: O sun; O moon,Which come forth from the east!Here is the man,With virtuous words, but really not good.How can he get his mind settled?Would he then allow me to be forgotten?

passages.zh: 日居月諸、東方自出。父兮母兮、畜我不卒。胡能有定、報我不述。
passages.en: O sun; o moon,From the east which come forth!O father, O mother,There is no sequel to your nourishing of me.How can he get his mind settled?Would he then respond to me, contrary to all reason?

passages.zh: 終風且暴、顧我則笑。謔浪笑敖、中心是悼。
passages.en: The wind blows and is fierce,He looks at me and smiles,With scornful words and dissolute, - the smile of pride.To the center of my heart I am grieved.

passages.zh: 終風且霾、惠然肯來。莫往莫來、悠悠我思。
passages.en: The wind blows, with clouds of dust.Kindly he seems to be willing to come to me;[But] he neither goes nor comes.Long, long, do I think of him.

passages.zh: 終風且曀、不日有曀。寤言不寐、願言則嚏。
passages.en: The wind blew, and the sky was cloudy;Before a day elapses, it is cloudy again.I awake, and cannot sleep;I think of him, and gasp.

passages.zh: 曀曀其陰、虺虺其靁。寤言不寐、願言則懷。
passages.en: All cloudy is the darkness,And the thunder keeps muttering.I awake and cannot sleep;I think of him, and my breast is full of pain.

passages.zh: 擊鼓其鏜、踊躍用兵。土國城漕、我獨南行。
passages.en: Hear the roll of our drums!See how we leap about, using our weapons!Those do the fieldwork in the State, or fortify Cao,While we alone march to the south.

passages.zh: 從孫子仲、平陳與宋。不我以歸、憂心有忡。
passages.en: We followed Sun Zizhong,Peace having been made with Chen and Song;[But] he did not lead us back,And our sorrowful hearts are very sad.

passages.zh: 爰居爰處、爰喪其馬。于以求之、于林之下。
passages.en: Here we stay, here we stop;Here we lose our horses;And we seek for them,Among the trees of the forest.

passages.zh: 死生契闊、與子成說。執子之手、與子偕老。
passages.en: For life or for death, however separated,To our wives we pledged our word.We held their hands; -We were to grow old together with them.

passages.zh: 于嗟闊兮、不我活兮。于嗟洵兮、不我信兮。
passages.en: Alas for our separation!We have no prospect of life.Alas for our stipulation!We cannot make it good.

passages.zh: 凱風自南、吹彼棘心。棘心夭夭、母氏劬勞。
passages.en: The genial wind from the southBlows on the heart of that jujube tree,Till that heart looks tender and beautiful.What toil and pain did our mother endure!

passages.zh: 凱風自南、吹彼棘薪。母氏聖善、我無令人。
passages.en: The genial wind from the southBlows on the branches of that jujube tree,Our mother is wise and good;But among us there is none good.

passages.zh: 爰有寒泉、在浚之下。有子七人、母氏勞苦。
passages.en: There is the cool springBelow [the city of] Jun.We are seven sons,And our mother is full of pain and suffering.

passages.zh: 睍睆黃鳥、載好其音。有子七人、莫慰母心。
passages.en: The beautiful yellow birdsGive forth their pleasant notes.We are seven sons,And cannot compose our mother's heart.

passages.zh: 雄雉于飛、泄泄其羽。我之懷矣、自詒伊阻。
passages.en: The male pheasant flies away,Lazily moving his wings.The man of my heart! -He has brought on us this separation.

passages.zh: 雄雉于飛、下上其音。展矣君子、實勞我心。
passages.en: The pheasant has flown away,But from below, from above, comes his voice.Ah! the princely man! -He afflicts my heart.

passages.zh: 瞻彼日月、悠悠我思。道之云遠、曷云能來。
passages.en: Look at that sun and moon!Long, long do I think.The way is distant;How can he come to me?

passages.zh: 百爾君子、不知德行。不忮不求、何用不臧。
passages.en: All ye princely men,Know ye not his virtuous conduct?He hates none; he covets nothing; -What does he which is not good?

passages.zh: 匏有苦葉、濟有深涉。深則厲、淺則揭。
passages.en: The gourd has [still] its bitter leaves,And the crossing at the ford is deep.If deep, I will go through with my clothes on;If shallow, I will do so, holding them up.

passages.zh: 有瀰濟盈、有鷕雉鳴。濟盈不濡軌、雉鳴求起牡。
passages.en: The ford is full to overflowing;There is the note of the female pheasant.The full ford will not wet the axle of my carriage;It is the pheasant calling for her mate.

passages.zh: 雝雝鳴鴈、旭日始旦。士如歸妻、迨冰未泮。
passages.en: The wild goose, with its harmonious notes,At sunrise, with the earliest dawn,By the gentleman, who wishes to bring home his bride,[Is presented] before the ice is melted.

passages.zh: 招招舟子、人涉卬否。人涉卬否、卬須我友。
passages.en: The boatman keeps beckoning;And others cross with him, but I do not.Others cross with him, but I do not; -I am waiting for my friend.

passages.zh: 習習谷風、以陰以雨。黽勉同心、不宜有怒。采葑采菲、無以下體。德音莫違、及爾同死。
passages.en: Gently blows the east wind,With cloudy skies and with rain.[Husband and wife] should strive to be of the same mind,And not let angry feelings arise.When we gather the mustard plant and earth melons,We do not reject them because of their roots.While I do nothing contrary to my good name,I should live with you till our death.

passages.zh: 行道遲遲、中心有違。不遠伊邇、薄送我畿。誰謂荼苦、其甘如薺。宴爾新昏、如兄如弟。
passages.en: I go along the road slowly, slowly,In my inmost heart reluctant.Not far, only a little way,Did he accompany me to the threshold.Who says that the sowthistle is bitter?It is as sweet as the shepherd's purse.You feast with your new wife,[Loving] as brothers.

passages.zh: 涇以渭濁、湜湜其沚。宴爾新昏、不我屑以。毋逝我梁、毋發我笱。我躬不閱、遑恤我後。
passages.en: The muddiness of the Jing appears from the Wei,But its bottom may be seen about the islets.You feast with your new wife,And think me not worth being withDo not approach my dam,Do not move my basket.My person is rejected; -What avails it to care for what may come after?

passages.zh: 就其深矣、方之舟之。就其淺矣、泳之游之。何有何亡、黽勉求之。凡民有喪、匍匐救之。
passages.en: Where the water was deep,I crossed it by a raft or a boat.Where it was shallow,I dived or swam across it.Whether we had plenty or not,I exerted myself to be getting.When among others there was a death,I crawled on my knees to help them.

passages.zh: 不我能慉、反以我為讎。既阻我德、賈用不售。昔育恐育鞫、及爾顛覆。既生既育、比予于毒。
passages.en: You cannot cherish me,And you even count me as an enemy.You disdain my virtues, -A pedlar's wares which do not sell.Formerly, I was afraid our means might be exhausted,And I might come with you to destitution.Now, when your means are abundant,You compare me to poison.

passages.zh: 我有旨蓄、亦以御冬。宴爾新昏、以我御窮。有洸有潰、既詒我肄。不念昔者、伊余來塈。
passages.en: My fine collection of vegetables,Is but a provision against the winter.Feasting with your new wife,You think of me as a provision [only] against your poverty.Cavalierly and angrily you treat me;You give me only pain.You do not think of the former days,And are only angry with me.

passages.zh: 式微式微、胡不歸。微君之故、胡為乎中露。
passages.en: Reduced! Reduced!Why not return?If it were not for your sake, O prince,How should we be thus exposed to the dew?

passages.zh: 式微式微、胡不歸。微君之躬、胡為乎泥中。
passages.en: Reduced! Reduced!Why not return?If it were not for your person, O prince,How should we be here in the mire?

passages.zh: 旄丘之葛兮、何誕之節兮。叔兮伯兮、何多日也。
passages.en: The dolichos on that high and sloping mound; -How wide apart are [now] its joints!O ye uncles,Why have ye delayed these many days?

passages.zh: 何其處也、必有與也。何其久也、必有以也。
passages.en: Why do they rest without stirring?It must be they expect allies.Why do they prolong the time?There must be a reason for their conduct.

passages.zh: 狐裘蒙戎、匪車不東。叔兮伯兮、靡所與同。
passages.en: Our fox-furs are frayed and worn.Came our carriages not eastwards?O ye uncles,You do not sympathize with us.

passages.zh: 瑣兮尾兮、流離之子。叔兮伯兮、褎如充耳。
passages.en: Fragments, and a remnant,Children of dispersion [are we]!O ye uncles,Notwithstanding your full robes, your ears are stopped.

passages.zh: 簡兮簡兮、方將萬舞。日之方中、在前上處。
passages.en: Easy and indifferent! easy and indifferent!I am ready to perform in all dances,Then when the sun is in the meridian,There in that conspicious place.

passages.zh: 碩人俁俁、公庭萬舞。有力如虎、執轡如組。
passages.en: With my large figure,I dance in the ducal courtyard.I am strong [also] as a tiger;The reins are in my grasp like ribbons.

passages.zh: 左手執籥、右手秉翟。赫如渥赭、公言錫爵。
passages.en: In my left hand I grasp a flute;In my right I hold a pheasant's feather.I am red as if I were rouged;The duke gives me a cup [of spirits].

passages.zh: 山有榛、隰有苓。云誰之思、西方美人。彼美人兮、西方之人兮。
passages.en: The hazel grows on the hills,And the liquorice in the marshes.Of whom are my thoughts?Of the fine men of the west.O those fine men!Those men of the west!

passages.zh: 毖彼泉水、亦流于淇。有懷于衛、靡日不思。孌彼諸姬、聊與之謀。
passages.en: How the water bubbles up from that spring,And flows away to the Qi!My heart is in Wei;There is not a day I do not think of it.Admirable are those, my cousins;I will take counsel with them.

passages.zh: 出宿于泲、飲餞于禰。女子有行、遠父母兄弟。問我諸姑、遂及伯姊。
passages.en: When I came forth, I lodged in Ji,And we drank the cup of convoy at Ni.When a young lady goes [to be married],She leaves her parents and brothers;[But] I would ask for my aunts,And then for my elder sister.

passages.zh: 出宿于干、飲餞于言。載脂載牽、還車言邁。遄臻于衛、不瑕有害。
passages.en: I will go forth and lodge in Gan,And we drink the cup of convoy at Yan.I will grease the axle and fix the pin,And the returning chariot will proceed.Quickly shall we arrive in Wei; -But would not this be wrong?

passages.zh: 我思肥泉、茲之永歎。思須與漕、我心悠悠。駕言出遊、以寫我憂。
passages.en: I think of the Feiquan,I am ever sighing about it.I think of Xu and Cao,Long, long, my heart dwells with them.Let me drive forth and travel there,To dissipate my sorrow.

passages.zh: 出自北門、憂心殷殷。終窶且貧、莫知我艱。已焉哉、天實為之、謂之何哉。
passages.en: I go out at the north gate,With my heart full of sorrow.Straitened am I and poor,And no one takes knowledge of my distress.So it is!Heaven has done it; -What then shall I say?

passages.zh: 王事適我、政事一埤益我。我入自外、室人交徧讁我。已焉哉、天實為之、謂之何哉。
passages.en: The king's business comes on me,And the affairs of our government in increasing measure.When I come home from abroad,The members of my family all emulously reproach me.So it is!Heaven has done it; -What then shall I say?

passages.zh: 王事敦我、政事一埤遺我。我入自外、室人交徧摧我。已焉哉、天實為之、謂之何哉。
passages.en: The king's business is thrown on me,And the affairs of our government are left to me more and more.When I come home from abroad,The members of my family all emulously thrust at me.So it is!Heaven has done it; -What then shall I say?

passages.zh: 北風其涼、雨雪其雱。惠而好我、攜手同行。其虛其邪、既亟只且。
passages.en: Cold blows the north wind;Thick falls the snow.Ye who love and regard me,Let us join hands and go together.Is it a time for delay?The urgency is extreme!

passages.zh: 北風其喈、雨雪其霏。惠而好我、攜手同歸。其虛其邪、既亟只且。
passages.en: The north wind whistles;The snow falls and drifts about.Ye who love and regard me,Let us join hands, and go away for ever.Is it a time for delay?The urgency is extreme!

passages.zh: 莫赤匪狐、莫黑匪烏。惠而好我、攜手同車。其虛其邪、既亟只且。
passages.en: Nothing red is seen but foxes,Nothing black but crows.Ye who love and regard me,Let us join hands, and go together in our carriages.Is it a time for delay?The urgency is extreme!

passages.zh: 靜女其姝、俟我於城隅。愛而不見、搔首踟躕。
passages.en: How lovely is the retiring girl!She was to await me at a corner of the wall.Loving and not seeing her,I scratch my head, and am in perplexity.

passages.zh: 靜女其孌、貽我彤管。彤管有煒、說懌女美。
passages.en: How handsome is the retiring girl!She presented to me a red tube.Bright is the red tube; -I delight in the beauty of the girl.

passages.zh: 自牧歸荑、洵美且異。匪女之為美、美人之貽。
passages.en: From the pasture lands she gave a shoot of the white grass,Truly elegant and rare.It is not you, O grass, that are elegant; -You are the gift of an elegant girl.

passages.zh: 新臺有泚、河水瀰瀰。燕婉之求、籧篨不鮮。
passages.en: Fresh and bright is the New Tower,On the waters of the He, wide and deep.A pleasant, genial mate she sought,[And has got this] vicious bloated mass!

passages.zh: 新臺有洒、河水浼浼。燕婉之求、籧篨不殄。
passages.en: Lofty is the New Tower,On the waters of the He, flowing still.A pleasant, genial mate she sought,[And has got this] vicious bloated mass!

passages.zh: 魚網之設、鴻則離之。燕婉之求、得此戚施。
passages.en: It was a fish net that was set,And a goose has fallen into it.A pleasant, genial mate she sought,And she has got this hunchback.

passages.zh: 二子乘舟、汎汎其景。願言思子、中心養養。
passages.en: The two youths got into their boats,Whose shadows floated about [on the water].I think longingly of them,And my heart is tossed about in uncertainty.

passages.zh: 二子乘舟、汎汎其逝。願言思子、不瑕有害。
passages.en: The two youths got into their boats,Which floated away [on the stream].I think longingly of them,Did they not come to harm?

passages.zh: 汎彼柏舟、在彼中河。髧彼兩髦、實維我儀。之死矢靡它。母也天只、不諒人只。
passages.en: It floats about, that boat of cypress wood,There in the middle of the He.With his two tufts of hair falling over his forehead,He was my mate;And I swear that till death I will have no other.O mother, O Heaven,Why will you not understand me?

passages.zh: 汎彼柏舟、在彼河側。髧彼兩髦、實維我特。之死矢靡慝。母也天只、不諒人只。
passages.en: It floats about, that boat of cypress wood,There by the side of the He.With his two tufts of hair falling over his forehead,He was my only one;And I swear that till death I will not do the evil thing.O mother, O Heaven,Why will you not understand me?

passages.zh: 牆有茨、不可埽也。中冓之言、不可道也。所可道也、言之醜也。
passages.en: The tribulus grows on the wall,And cannot be brushed away.The story of the inner chamber,Cannot be told.What would have to be told,Would be the vilest of recitals.

passages.zh: 牆有茨、不可襄也。中冓之言、不可詳也。所可詳也、言之長也。
passages.en: The tribulus grow on the wall,And cannot be removed.The story of the inner chamber,Cannot be particularly related.What might be particularly relatedWould be a long story.

passages.zh: 牆有茨、不可束也。中冓之言、不可讀也。所可讀也、言之辱也。
passages.en: The tribulus grow on the wall,And cannot be bound together, [and taken away].The story of the inner chamberCannot be recited,What might be recited,Would be the most disgraceful of things.

passages.zh: 君子偕老、副笄六珈。委委佗佗、如山如河、象服是宜。子之不淑、云如之何。
passages.en: The husband's to their old age,In her headdress, and the cross-pins, with their six jewels;Easy and elegant in her movements;[Stately] as a mountain, [majestic]as a river,Well beseeming her pictured robes:[But] with your want of virtue, O lady,What have you to do with these things?

passages.zh: 玼兮玼兮、其之翟也。鬒髮如云、不屑髢也。玉之瑱也、象之揥也、揚且之皙也。胡然而天也、胡然而帝也。
passages.en: How rich and splendidIs her pheasant-figured robe!Her black hair in masses like clouds,No false locks does she descend to.There are her ear-plugs of jade,Her comb-pin of ivory,And her high forehead, so white.She appears like a visitant from heaven!She appears like a goddess!

passages.zh: 瑳兮瑳兮、其之展也。蒙彼縐絺、是紲袢也。子之清揚、揚且之顏也。展如之人兮、邦之媛也。
passages.en: How rich and splendidIs her robe of state!It is worn over the finest muslin of dolichos,The more cumbrous and warm garment being removed.Clear are her eyes; fine is her forehead;Full are her temples.Ah! such a woman as this!The beauty of the country!

passages.zh: 爰采唐矣、沬之鄉矣。云誰之思、美孟姜矣。期我乎桑中、要我乎上宮、送我乎淇之上矣。
passages.en: I am going to gather the dodder,In the fields of Mei.But of whom are my thoughts?Of that beauty, the eldest of the Jiang.She made an appontment with me in Sangzhong;She will meet me in Shanggong;She will accompany me to Qishang.

passages.zh: 爰采麥矣、沬之北矣。云誰之思、美孟弋矣。期我乎桑中、要我乎上宮、送我乎淇之上矣 。
passages.en: I am going to gather the wheat,In the north of Mei.But of whom are my thoughts?Of that beauty, the eldest of the Yi.She made an appontment with me in Sangzhong;She will meet me in Shanggong;She will accompany me to Qishang.

passages.zh: 爰采葑矣、沬之東矣。云誰之思、美孟庸矣。期我乎桑中、要我乎上宮、送我乎淇之上矣。
passages.en: I am going to gather the mustard plant,,In the east of Mei.But of whom are my thoughts?Of that beauty, the eldest of the Yong.She made an appontment with me in Sangzhong;She will meet me in Shanggong;She will accompany me to Qishang.

passages.zh: 鶉之奔奔、鵲之彊彊。人之無良、我以為兄。
passages.en: Boldly faithful in their pairings are quails;Vigorously so are magpies.This man is all vicious,And I consider him my brother!

passages.zh: 鵲之彊彊、鶉之奔奔。人之無良、我以為君。
passages.en: Vigorously faithful in their pairings are magpies;Boldly so are quails.This woman is all vicious,And I regard her as marchioness.

passages.zh: 定之方中、作于楚宮。揆之以日、作于楚室。樹之榛栗、椅桐梓漆、爰伐琴瑟。
passages.en: When Ding culminated [at night fall],He began to build the palace at Chu.Determining its aspects by means of the sun,He built the mansion at Chu.He planted about it hazel and chesnut trees,The yi, the tong, the zi, and the varnish-tree,Which, when cut down, might afford materials for lutes.

passages.zh: 升彼虛矣、以望楚矣。望楚與堂、景山與京。降觀于桑、卜云其吉、終然允臧。
passages.en: He ascended those old walls,And thense surveyed [the site of ] Chu.He surveyed Chu and Tang,With the high hills and lofty elevations about :He descended and examined the mulberry trees;He then divined, and got a fortunate response;And thus the issue has been truly good.

passages.zh: 靈雨既零、命彼倌人。星言夙駕、說于桑田。匪直也人、秉心塞淵、騋牝三千。
passages.en: When the good rains had fallen,He would order his groom,By starlight, in the morning, to yoke his carriage,And would then stop among the mulberry trees and fields.But not only thus did he show what he was; -Maintaining in his heart a profound devotion to his duties,His tall horses and mares amounted to three thousand.

passages.zh: 蝃蝀在東、莫之敢指。女子有行、遠父母兄弟。
passages.en: There is a rainbow in the east,And no one dares to point to it.When a girl goes away [from her home],She separates from her parents and brothers.

passages.zh: 朝隮于西、崇朝其雨。女子有行、遠兄弟父母。
passages.en: In the morning [a rainbow] rises in the west,And [only] during the morning is there rain.When a girl goes away [from her home],She separates from her brothers and parents.

passages.zh: 乃如之人也、懷昏姻也。大無信也、不知命也。
passages.en: This personHas her heart only on being married.Greatly is she untrue to herself,And does not recognize [the law of] her lot.

passages.zh: 相鼠有皮、人而無儀。人而無儀、不死何為。
passages.en: Look at a rat, - it has its skin;But a man should be without dignity of demeanour.If a man have no dignity of demeanour,What should he but die?

passages.zh: 相鼠有齒、人而無止。人而無止、不死何俟。
passages.en: Look at a rat, - it has its teeth;But a man shall be without any right deportment.If a man have not right deportment,What should he wait for but death?

passages.zh: 相鼠有體、人而無禮。人而無禮、胡不遄死。
passages.en: Look at a rat, - it has its limbs;But a man shall be without any rules of propriety.If a man observe no rules of propriety,Why does he not quickly die?

passages.zh: 孑孑干旄、在浚之郊。素絲紕之、良馬四之。彼姝者子、何以畀之。
passages.en: Conspiciously rise the staffs with their ox-tails,In the distant suburbs of Jun,Ornamented with the white silk bands;There are four carriages with their good horses,That admirable gentleman, -What will he give them [for his]?

passages.zh: 孑孑干旟、在浚之都。素絲組之、良馬五之。彼姝者子、何以予之。
passages.en: Conspiciously rise the staffs with their falcon-banners,In the nearer suburbs of Jun,Ornamented with the white silk ribbons;There are four carriages with their good horses,That admirable gentleman, -What will he give them [for his]?

passages.zh: 孑孑干旌、在浚之城。素絲祝之、良馬六之。彼姝者子、何以告之。
passages.en: Conspiciously rise the staffs with their feathered streamers,At the walls of Jun,Bound with the white silk cords;There are six carriages with their good horses,That admirable gentleman, -What will he give them [for his]?

passages.zh: 載馳載驅、歸唁衛侯。驅馬悠悠、言至于漕。大夫跋涉、我心則憂。
passages.en: I would have galloped my horses and whipt them,Returning to condole with the marquis of Wei.I would have urged them all the long way,Till I arrived at Cao.A great officer has gone, over the hills and through the rivers;But my heart is full of sorrow.

passages.zh: 既不我嘉、不能旋反。視爾不臧、我思不遠。既不我嘉、不能旋濟。視爾不臧、我思不閟。
passages.en: You disapproved of my [proposal],And I cannot return to [Wei];But I regard you as in the wrong,And cannot forget my purpose.You disapproved of my purpose,But I cannot return across the streams;But I regard you as in the wrong,And cannot shut out my thoughts.

passages.zh: 陟彼阿丘、言采其蝱。女子善懷、亦各有行。許人尤之、眾穉且狂。
passages.en: I will ascend that mound with the steep side,And gather the mother-of-pearl lilies.I might, as a woman, have many thoughts,But every one of them was practicable.The people of Xu blame me,But they are all childish and hasty [in their conclusions].

passages.zh: 我行其野、芃芃其麥。控于大邦、誰因誰極。大夫君子、無我有尤。百爾所思、不如我所之。
passages.en: I would have gone through the country,Amidst the wheat so luxuriant.I would have carried the case before the great State.On whom should I have relied? Who would come [to the help of Wei]?Ye great officers and gentlemen,Do not condemn me.The hundred plans you think ofAre not equal to the course I was going to take.

passages.zh: 瞻彼淇奧、綠竹猗猗。有匪君子、如切如磋、如琢如磨。瑟兮僩兮、赫兮咺兮。有匪君子、終不可諼兮。
passages.en: Look at those recesses in the banks of the Qi,With their green bamboos, so fresh and luxuriant!There is our elegant and accomplished prince, -As from the knife and the file,As from the chisel and the polisher!How grave is he and dignified!How commanding and distinguished!Our elegant and accomplished prince, -Never can he be forgotten!

passages.zh: 瞻彼淇奧、綠竹青青。有匪君子、充耳琇瑩、會弁如星。瑟兮僩兮、赫兮咺兮。有匪君子、終不可諼兮。
passages.en: Look at those recesses in the banks of the Qi,With their green bamboos, so strong and luxuriant!There is our elegant and accomplished prince, -With his ear-stoppers of beautiful pebbles,And his cap, glittering as with stars between the seams!How grave is he and dignified!How commanding and distinguished!Our elegant and accomplished prince, -Never can he be forgotten!

passages.zh: 瞻彼淇奧、綠竹如簀。有匪君子、如金如錫、如圭如璧。寬兮綽兮、猗重較兮。善戲謔兮、不為虐兮。
passages.en: Look at those recesses in the banks of the Qi,With their green bamboos, so dense together!There is our elegant and accomplished prince, -[Pure] as gold or as tin,[Soft and rich] as a sceptre of jade!How magnanimous is he and gentle!There he is in his chariot with its two high sides!Skilful is he at quips and jokes,But how does he keep from rudeness in them!

passages.zh: 考槃在㵎、碩人之寬。獨寐寤言、永矢弗諼。
passages.en: He has reared his hut by the stream in the valley,- That large man, so much at his ease.Alone he sleeps, and wakes, and talks.He swears he will never forgets [his true joy].

passages.zh: 考槃在阿、碩人之薖。獨寐寤歌、永矢弗過。
passages.en: He has reared his hut in the bend of the mound,- That large man, with such an air of indifference.Alone he sleeps, and wakes, and sings.He swears he will never pass from the spot.

passages.zh: 考槃在陸、碩人之軸。獨寐寤宿、永矢弗告。
passages.en: He has reared his hut on the level height,- That large man, so self-collected.Alone, he sleeps and wakes, and sleeps again.He swears he will never tell [of his delight].

passages.zh: 碩人其頎、衣錦褧衣。齊侯之子、衛侯之妻、東宮之妹、邢侯之姨、譚公維私。
passages.en: Large was she and tall,In her embroidered robe, with a [plain] single garment over it:The daughter of the marquis of Qi.The wife of the marquis of Wei,The sister of the heir-son of QiThe sister-in-law of the marquis of Xing,The viscount of Tan also her brother-in-law.

passages.zh: 手如柔荑。膚如凝脂。領如蝤蠐。齒如瓠犀。螓首蛾眉。巧笑倩兮。美目盼兮。
passages.en: Her fingers were like the blades of the young white-grass;Her skin was like congealed ointment;Her neck was like the tree-grub;Her teeth were like melon seeds;Her forehead cicada-like; her eyebrows like [the antenne of] the silkworm moth;What dimples, as she artfully smiled!How lovely her eyes, with the black and white so well defined!

passages.zh: 碩人敖敖、說于農郊。四牡有驕、朱幩鑣鑣、翟茀以朝。大夫夙退、無使君勞。
passages.en: Large was she and tall,When she halted in the cultivated suburbs.Strong looked her four horses,With the red ornaments so rich about their bits.Thus in her carriage, with its screens of pheasant feathers,she proceeded to our court.Early retire, ye great officers,And do not make the marquis fatigued!

passages.zh: 河水洋洋、北流活活。施罛濊濊、鱣鮪發發、葭菼揭揭。庶姜孽孽、庶士有朅。
passages.en: The waters of the He, wide and deep,Flow northwards in majestic course.The nets are dropt into them with a plashing sound,Among shoals of sturgeon, large and small,While the rushes and sedges are rank about.Splendidly adorned were her sister ladies;Martial looked the attendant officers.

passages.zh: 氓之蚩蚩、抱布貿絲。匪來貿絲、來即我謀。送子涉淇、至于頓丘。匪我愆期、子無良媒。將子無怒、秋以為期。
passages.en: A simple-looking lad you were,Carrying cloth to exchange it for silk.[But] you came not so to purchase silk; -You came to make proposals to me.I convoyed you through the Qi,As far as Dunqiu.' It is not I, ' [I said], ' who would protract the time;But you have had no good go-between.I pray you be not angry,And let autumn be the time. '

passages.zh: 乘彼垝垣、以望復關。不見復關、泣涕漣漣。既見復關、載笑載言。爾卜爾筮、體無咎言。以爾車來、以我賄遷。
passages.en: I ascended that ruinous wall,To look towards Fuguan;And when I saw [you] not [coming from] it;My tears flowed in streams.When I did see [you coming from] Fuquan,I laughed and I spoke.You had consulted, [you said], the tortoise-shell and the reeds,And there was nothing unfavourable in their response.' Then come, ' [I said], ' with your carriage,And I will remove with my goods.

passages.zh: 桑之未落、其葉沃若。于嗟鳩兮、無食桑葚。于嗟女兮、無與士耽。士之耽兮、猶可說也、女之耽兮、 不可說也。
passages.en: Before the mulberry tree has shed its leaves,How rich and glossy are they!Ah! thou dove,Eat not its fruit [to excess].Ah! thou young lady,Seek no licentious pleasure with a gentleman.When a gentleman indulges in such pleasure,Something may still be said for him;When a lady does so,Nothing can be said for her.

passages.zh: 桑之落矣、其黃而隕。自我徂爾、三歲食貧。淇水湯湯、漸車帷裳。女也不爽、士貳其行。士也罔極、二三其德。
passages.en: When the mulberry tree sheds its leaves,They fall yellow on the ground.Since I went with you,Three years have I eaten of your poverty;And [now] the full waters of the Qi,Wet the curtains of my carriage.There has been no difference in me,But you have been double in your ways.It is you, Sir, who transgress the right,Thus changeable in your conduct.

passages.zh: 三歲為婦、靡室勞矣。夙興夜寐、靡有朝矣。言既遂矣、至于暴矣。兄弟不知、咥其笑矣。靜言思之、躬自悼矣。
passages.en: For three years I was your wife,And thought nothing of my toil in your house.I rose early and went to sleep late,Not intermitting my labours for a morning.Thus [on my part] our contract was fulfilled,But you have behaved thus cruelly.My brothers will not know [all this],And will only laugh at me.Silently I think of it,And bemoan myself.

passages.zh: 及爾偕老、老使我怨。淇則有岸、隰則有泮。總角之宴、言笑晏晏。信誓旦旦、不思其反。反是不思、亦已焉哉。
passages.en: I was to grow old with you; -Old, you give me cause for sad repining.The Qi has its banks,And the marsh has its shores.In the pleasant time of my girlhood, with my hair simply gathered in a knot,Harmoniously we talked and laughed.Clearly were we sworn to good faith,And I did not think the engagement would be broken.That it would be broken I did not think,And now it must be all over!

passages.zh: 籊籊竹竿、以釣于淇。豈不爾思、遠莫致之。
passages.en: With your long and tapering bamboo rods,You angle in the Qi.Do I not think of you?But I am far away, and cannot get to you.

passages.zh: 泉源在左、淇水在右。女子有行、遠兄弟父母。
passages.en: The Quanyuan is on the left,And the waters of the Qi are on the right.But when a young lady goes away, [and is married],She leaves her brothers and parents.

passages.zh: 淇水在右、泉源在左。巧笑之瑳、佩玉之儺。
passages.en: The waters of the Qi are on the rightAnd the Quanyuan is on the left.How shine the white teeth through the artful smiles!How the girdle gems move to the measured steps!

passages.zh: 淇水滺滺、檜楫松舟。駕言出遊、以寫我憂。
passages.en: The waters of the Qi flow smoothly;There are the oars of cedar and boats of pine.Might I but go there in my carriage and ramble,To dissipate my sorrow!

passages.zh: 芄蘭之支、童子佩觿。雖則佩觿、能不我知。容兮遂兮、垂帶悸兮。
passages.en: There are the branches of the sparrow-gourd; -There is that lad, with the spike at his girdle.Though he carries a spike at his girdle,He does not know us.How easy and conceited is his manner,With the ends of his girdle hanging down as they do!

passages.zh: 芄蘭之葉、童子佩韘。雖則佩韘、能不我甲。容兮遂兮、垂帶悸兮。
passages.en: There are the leaves of the sparrow-gourd; -There is that lad with the archer's thimble at his girdle.Though he carries an archer's thimble at his girdle,He is not superior to us.How easy and conceited is his manner,With the ends of his girdle hanging down as they do!

passages.zh: 誰謂河廣、一葦杭之。誰謂宋遠、跂予望之。
passages.en: Who says that the He is wide?With [a bundle of] reeds I can cross it.Who says that Song is distant?On tiptoe I can see it.

passages.zh: 誰謂河廣、曾不容刀。誰謂宋遠、曾不崇朝。
passages.en: Who says that the He is wide?It will not admit a little boat.Who says that Song is distant?It would not take a whole morning to reach it.

passages.zh: 伯兮朅兮、邦之桀兮。伯也執殳、為王前驅。
passages.en: My noble husband is how martial-like!The hero of the country!My husband, grasping his halberd,Is in the leading chariot of the king's [host].

passages.zh: 自伯之東、首如飛蓬。豈無膏沐、誰適為容。
passages.en: Since my husband went to the east,My head has been like the flying [pappus of the] artemisia.It is not that I could not anoint and wash it;But for whom should I adorn myself?

passages.zh: 其雨其雨、杲杲出日。願言思伯、甘心首疾。
passages.en: O for rain! O for rain!But brightly the sun comes forth.Longingly I think of my husband,Till my heart is weary, and my head aches.

passages.zh: 焉得諼草、言樹之背。願言思伯、使我心痗。
passages.en: How shall I get the plant of forgetfulness?I would plant it on the north of my house.Longingly I think of my husband,And my heart is made to ache.

passages.zh: 有狐綏綏、在彼淇梁。心之憂矣、之子無裳。
passages.en: There is a fox, solitary and suspicious,At that dam over the Qi.My heart is sad; -That man has no lower garment.

passages.zh: 有狐綏綏、在彼淇厲。心之憂矣、之子無帶。
passages.en: There is a fox, solitary and suspicious,At that deep ford of the Qi.My heart is sad; -That man has no girdle.

passages.zh: 有狐綏綏、在彼淇側。心之憂矣、之子無服。
passages.en: There is a fox, solitary and suspicious,By the side there of the Qi.My heart is sad; -That man has no clothes.

passages.zh: 投我以木瓜、報之以瓊琚。匪報也、永以為好也。
passages.en: There was presented to me a papaya,And I returned for it a beautiful Ju-gem;Not as a return for it,But that our friendship might be lasting.

passages.zh: 投我以木桃、報之以瓊瑤。匪報也、永以為好也。
passages.en: There was presented to me a peach,And I returned for it a beautiful Yao-gem;Not as a return for it,But that our friendship might be lasting.

passages.zh: 投我以木李、報之以瓊玖。匪報也、永以為好也。
passages.en: There was presented to me a plum,And I returned for it a beautiful Jiu-gem;Not as a return for it,But that our friendship might be lasting.

passages.zh: 緇衣之宜兮、敝、予又改為兮。適子之館兮、還、予授子之粲兮。
passages.en: How well do the black robes befit you!When worn out, we will make others for you.We will go to your court,And when we return [from it], we will send you a feast!

passages.zh: 緇衣之好兮、敝、予又改造兮。適子之館兮、還、予授子之粲兮。
passages.en: How good on you are the black robes!When worn out, we will make others for you.We will go to your court,And when we return [from it], we will send you a feast!

passages.zh: 緇衣之蓆兮、敝、予又改作兮。適子之館兮、還、予授子之粲兮。
passages.en: How easy sit the black robes on you!When worn out, we will make others for you.We will go to your court,And when we return [from it], we will send you a feast!

passages.zh: 將仲子兮、無踰我里、無折我樹杞。豈敢愛之、畏我父母。仲可懷也、父母之言、亦可畏也。
passages.en: I pray you, Mr. Zhong,Do not come leaping into my hamlet;Do not break my willow trees.Do I care for them?But I fear my parents.You, O Zhong, are to be loved,But the words of my parents,Are also to be feared.

passages.zh: 將仲子兮、無踰我墻、無折我樹桑。豈敢愛之、畏我諸兄。仲可懷也、諸兄之言、亦可畏也。
passages.en: I pray you, Mr. Zhong,Do not come leaping over my wall;Do not break my mulberry trees.Do I care for them?But I fear the words of my brothers.You, O Zhong, are to be loved,But the words of my brothers,Are also to be feared.

passages.zh: 將仲子兮、無踰我園、無折我樹檀。豈敢愛之、畏人之多言。仲可懷也、人之多言、亦可畏也。
passages.en: I pray you, Mr. Zhong,Do not come leaping into my garden;Do not break my sandal trees.Do I care for them?But I dread the talk of people.You, O Zhong, are to be loved,But the talk of people,Is also to be feared.

passages.zh: 叔于田、巷無居人。豈無居人、不如叔也、洵美且仁。
passages.en: Shu has gone hunting;And in the streets there are no inhabitants.Are there indeed no inhabitants?[But] they are not like Shu,Who is truly admirable and kind.

passages.zh: 叔于狩、巷無飲酒。豈無飲酒、不如叔也、洵美且好。
passages.en: Shu has gone to the grand chase;And in the streets there are none feasting.Are there indeed none feasting?[But] they are not like Shu,Who is truly admirable and good.

passages.zh: 叔適野、巷無服馬。豈無服馬、不如叔也、洵美且武。
passages.en: Shu has gone into the country;And in the streets there are none driving about.Are there indeed none driving about?[But] they are not like Shu,Who is truly admirable and martial.

passages.zh: 叔于田、乘乘馬、執轡如組、兩驂如舞。叔在藪、火烈具舉。襢裼暴虎、獻于公所。將叔無狃、戒其傷女。
passages.en: Shu has gone hunting,Mounted in his chariot and four.The reins are in his grasp like ribbons,While the two outside horses move [with regular steps], as dancers do.Shu is at the marshy ground; -The fire flames out all at once,And with bared arms he seizes a tiger,And presents it before the duke.O Shu, try not [such sport] again;Beware of getting hurt.

passages.zh: 叔于田、乘乘黃、兩服上襄、兩驂雁行。叔在藪、火烈具揚。叔善射忌、又良御忌、抑磬控忌、抑縱送忌。
passages.en: Shu has gone hunting,Mounted in his chariot with four bay horses.The two insides are the finest possible animals,And the two outsides follow them regularly as in a flying flock of wild geese.Shu is at the marshy ground; -The fire blazes up all at once,A skillful archer is Shu!A good charioteer also!Now he gives his horse the reins; now he brings them up;Now he discharges his arrows; now he follows it.

passages.zh: 叔于田、乘乘鴇、兩服齊首、兩驂如手。叔在藪、火烈具阜。叔馬慢忌、叔發罕忌、抑釋掤忌、抑鬯弓忌。
passages.en: Shu has gone hunting,Mounted in his chariot with four grey horses.His two insides have their heads in a line,And the two outsides come after like arms.Shu is at the marsh; -The fire spreads grandly all together.His horses move slowly;He shoots but seldom;Now he lays aside his quiver;Now he returns his bows to his case.

passages.zh: 清人在彭、駟介旁旁、二矛重英、河上乎翱翔。
passages.en: The men of Qing are in Peng;The chariot with its team in mail ever moves about;The two spears in it, with their ornaments, rising, one above the other.So do they roam about the He.

passages.zh: 清人在消、駟介麃麃、二矛重喬、河上乎逍遙。
passages.en: The men of Qing are in Xiao;The chariot with its team in mail looks martial;And the two spears in it, with their hooks, rise one above the other.So do they saunter about by the He.

passages.zh: 清人在軸、駟介陶陶、左旋右抽、中軍作好。
passages.en: The men of Qing are in Zhou;The mailed team of the chariot prance proudly.[The driver] on the left wheels it about, and [the spearman] on the right brandishes his weapon,While the general in the middle looks pleased.

passages.zh: 羔裘如濡、洵直且侯。彼其之子、舍命不渝。
passages.en: His lambs's fur is glossy,Truly smooth and beautiful.That officer,Rests in his lot and will not change.

passages.zh: 羔裘豹飾、孔武有力。彼其之子、邦之司直。
passages.en: His lambs's fur, with its cuffs of leopard-skin.Looks grandly martial and strong.That officer,In the country will ever hold to the right.

passages.zh: 羔裘晏兮、三英粲兮。彼其之子、邦之彥兮。
passages.en: How splendid is his lamb's fur!How bright are its three ornaments!That officer,Is the ornament of the country.

passages.zh: 遵大路兮、摻執子之袪兮。無我惡兮、不寁故也。
passages.en: Along the highway,I hold you by the cuff.Do not hate me; -Old intercourse should not be suddenly broken off.

passages.zh: 遵大路兮、摻執子之手兮。無我魗兮、不寁好也。
passages.en: Along the highway,I hold you by the hand.Do not think me vile; -Old friendship should not hastily be broken off.

passages.zh: 女曰雞鳴、士曰昧旦。子興視夜、明星有爛。將翱將翔、弋鳧與鴈。
passages.en: Says the wife, ' It is cock-crow; 'Says the husband, ' It is grey dawn. '' Rise, Sir, and look at the night, - 'If the morning star be not shining.Bestir yourself, and move about,To shoot the wild ducks and geese.

passages.zh: 弋言加之、與子宜之。宜言飲酒、與子偕老。琴瑟在御、莫不靜好。
passages.en: When your arrows and line have found them,I will dress them fitly for you.When they are dressed, we will drink [together over them],And I will hope to grow old with you.Your lute in your hands,Will emits its quiet pleasant tones.

passages.zh: 知子之來之、雜佩以贈之。知子之順之、雜佩以問之。知子之好之、雜佩以報之。
passages.en: When I know those whose acquaintance you wish,I will give them of the ornaments of my girdle.When I know those with whom you are cordial,I will send to them of the ornaments of my girdle.When I know those whom you love,I will repay their friendship from the ornaments of my girdle.

passages.zh: 有女同車、顏如舜華。將翱將翔、佩玉瓊琚。彼美孟姜、洵美且都。
passages.en: There is the lady in the carriage [with him],With the countenance like the flower of the ephermeral hedge-tree.As they move about,The beautiful Ju-gems of her girdle-pendant appear.That beautiful eldest Jiang,Is truly admirable and elegant.

passages.zh: 有女同行、顏如舜英。將翱將翔、佩玉將將。彼美孟姜、德音不忘。
passages.en: There is the young lady walking [with him],With a countenance like the ephermeral blossoms of the hedge-tree.As they move about,The gems of her girdle-pendant tinkle.Of that beautiful eldest Jiang,The virtuous fame is not to be forgotten.

passages.zh: 山有扶蘇、隰有荷華。不見子都、乃見狂且。
passages.en: On the mountain is the mulberry tree;In the marshes is the lotus flower.I do not see Zidu,But I see this mad fellow.

passages.zh: 山有橋松、隰有游龍。不見子充、乃見狡童。
passages.en: On the mountain is the lofty pine;In the marshes is the spreading water-polygonum..I do not see Zichong,But I see this artful boy.

passages.zh: 蘀兮蘀兮、風其吹女。叔兮伯兮、倡予和女。
passages.en: Ye withered leaves! Ye withered leaves!How the wind is blowing you away!O ye uncles,Give us the first note, and we will join in with you.

passages.zh: 蘀兮蘀兮、風其漂女。叔兮伯兮、倡予要女。
passages.en: Ye withered leaves! Ye withered leaves!How the wind is carrying you away!O ye uncles,Give us the first note, and we will complete [the song].

passages.zh: 彼狡童兮、不與我言兮。維子之故、使我不能餐兮。
passages.en: That artful boy!He will not speak with me!But for the sake of you, Sir,Shall I make myself unable to eat?

passages.zh: 彼狡童兮、不與我食兮。維子之故、使我不能息兮。
passages.en: That artful boy!He will not eat with me!But for the sake of you, Sir,Shall I make myself unable to rest?

passages.zh: 子惠思我、褰裳涉溱。子不我思、豈無他人。狂童之狂也且。
passages.en: If you, Sir, think kindly of me,I will hold up my lower garments, and cross the Zhen.If you do not think of me,Is there no other person [to do so]?You, foolish, foolish fellow!

passages.zh: 子惠思我、褰裳涉洧。子不我思、豈無他士。狂童之狂也且。
passages.en: If you, Sir, think kindly of me,I will hold up my lower garments, and cross the Wei.If you do not think of me,Is there no other gentleman [to do so]?You, foolish, foolish fellow!

passages.zh: 子之丰兮、俟我乎巷兮。悔予不送兮。
passages.en: Full and good looking was the gentleman,Who waited for me in the lane!I repent that I did not go with him.

passages.zh: 子之昌兮、俟我乎堂兮。悔予不將兮。
passages.en: A splendid gentleman was he,Who waited for me in the hall!I regret that I did not accompany him.

passages.zh: 衣錦褧衣、裳錦褧裳。叔兮伯兮、駕予與行。
passages.en: Over my embroidered upper robe, I have put on a [plain] single garment;Over my embroidered lower robe, I have done the same.O Sir, O Sir,Have your carriage ready for me to go with you.

passages.zh: 裳錦褧裳、衣錦褧衣。叔兮伯兮、駕予與歸。
passages.en: Over my embroidered lower robe, I have put on a [plain] single garment;Over my embroidered upper robe, I have done the same.O Sir, O Sir,Have your carriage ready to take me home with you.

passages.zh: 東門之墠、茹藘在阪。其室則邇、其人甚遠。
passages.en: Near the level ground at the east gate,Is the madder plant on the bank.The house is near there,But the man is very far away.

passages.zh: 東門之栗、有踐家室。豈不爾思、子不我即。
passages.en: By the chestnut trees at the east gate,Is a row of houses.Do I not think of you?But you do not come to me.

passages.zh: 風雨淒淒、雞鳴喈喈。既見君子、云胡不夷。
passages.en: Cold are the wind and the rain,And shrilly crows the cock.But I have seen my husband,And should I but feel at rest?

passages.zh: 風雨瀟瀟、雞鳴膠膠。既見君子、云胡不瘳。
passages.en: The wind whistles and the rain patters,While loudly crows the cock.But I have seen my husband,And could my ailment but be cured?

passages.zh: 風雨如晦、雞鳴不已。既見君子、云胡不喜。
passages.en: Through the wind and rain all looks dark,And the cock crows without ceasing.But I have seen my husband,And how should I not rejoice?

passages.zh: 青青子衿、悠悠我心。縱我不往、子寧不嗣音。
passages.en: O you, with the blue collar,Prolonged is the anxiety of my heart.Although I do not go [to you],Why do you not continue your messages [to me]?

passages.zh: 青青子佩、悠悠我思。縱我不往、子寧不來。
passages.en: O you with the blue [strings to your] girdle-gems,Long, long do I think of you.Although I do not go [to you],Why do you not come [to me]?

passages.zh: 挑兮達兮、在城闕兮。一日不見、如三月兮。
passages.en: How volatile are you and dissipated,By the look-out tower on the wall!One day without the sight of you,Is like three months.

passages.zh: 揚之水、不流束楚。終鮮兄弟、維予與女。無信人之言、人實迋女。
passages.en: The fretted waters,Do not carry on their current a bundle of thorns.Few are our brethren;There are only I and you.Do not believe what people say;They are deceiving you.

passages.zh: 揚之水、不流束薪。終鮮兄弟、維予二人。無信人之言、人實不信。
passages.en: The fretted waters,Do not carry on their current a bundle of firewood.Few are our brethren;There are only we two.Do not believe what people say;They are not to be trusted.

passages.zh: 出其東門、有女如雲。雖則如雲、匪我思存。縞衣綦巾、聊樂我員。
passages.en: I went out at the east gate,Where the girls were in clouds.Although they are like clouds,It is not on them that my thoughts rest.She in the thin white silk, and the grey coiffure, -She is my joy!

passages.zh: 出其闉闍、有女如荼。雖則如荼、匪我思且。縞衣茹藘、聊可與娛。
passages.en: I went out by the tower on the covering wall,Where the girls were like flowering rushes.Although they are like flowering rushes,It is not of them that I think.She in the thin white silk, and the madder-[dyed coiffure], -It is she that makes me happy!

passages.zh: 野有蔓草、零露漙兮。有美一人、清揚婉兮。邂逅相遇、適我願兮。
passages.en: On the moor is the creeping grass,And how heavily is it loaded with dew!There was a beautiful man,Lovely, with clear eyes and fine forehead!We met together accidentally,And so my desire was satisfied.

passages.zh: 野有蔓草、零露瀼瀼。有美一人、婉如清揚。邂逅相遇、與子偕臧。
passages.en: On the moor is the creeping grass,Heavily covered with dew!There was a beautiful man,Lovely, with clear eyes and fine forehead!We met together accidentally,And he and I were happy together.

passages.zh: 溱與洧、方渙渙兮。士與女、方秉蕑兮。女曰觀乎。士曰既且。且往觀乎。洧之外、洵訏且樂。維士與女、伊其相謔、贈之以勺藥。
passages.en: The Zhen and Wei,Now present their broad sheets of water.Ladies and gentlemen,Are carrying flowers of valerian.A lady says, ' Have you been to see? 'A gentleman replies, ' I have been. '' But let us go again to see.Beyond the Wei,The ground is large and fit for pleasure. 'So the gentlemen and ladies.Make sport together,Presenting one another with small peonies.

passages.zh: 溱與洧、瀏其清矣。士與女、殷其盈兮。女曰觀乎。士曰既且。且往觀乎。洧之外、洵訏且樂。維士與女、伊其將謔、贈之以勺藥。
passages.en: The Zhen and Wei,Show their deep, clear streams.Gentlemen and ladies,Appear in crowds.A lady says, ' Have you been to see? 'A gentleman replies, ' I have been. '' But let us go again to see.Beyond the Wei,The ground is large and fit for pleasure. 'So the gentlemen and ladies.Make sport together,Presenting one another with small peonies.

passages.zh: 雞既鳴矣、朝既盈矣。匪雞則鳴、蒼蠅之聲。
passages.en: ' The cock has crowed;The court is full. 'But it was not the cock that was crowing; -It was the sound of the blue flies.

passages.zh: 東方明矣、朝既昌矣。匪東方則明、月出之光。
passages.en: ' The east is bright;The court is crowded. 'But it was not the east that was bright; -It was the light of the moon coming forth.

passages.zh: 蟲飛薨薨、甘與子同夢。會且歸矣、無庶予子憎。
passages.en: ' The insects are flying in buzzing crowds;It would be sweet to lie by you and dream. 'But the assembled officers will be going home; -Let them not hate both me and you. '

passages.zh: 子之還兮、遭我乎峱之閒兮。並驅從兩肩兮、揖我謂我儇兮。
passages.en: How agile you are!You met me in the neighbourhood of Nao,And we pursued together two boars of three years.You bowed to me, and said that I was active.

passages.zh: 子之茂兮、遭我乎峱之道兮。並驅從兩牡兮、揖我謂我好兮。
passages.en: How admirable your skill!You met me in the way to Nao,And we drove together after two males.You bowed to me, and said that I was skilful.

passages.zh: 子之昌兮、遭我乎峱之陽兮。並驅從兩狼兮、揖我謂我臧兮。
passages.en: How complete your art!You met me on the south of Nao,And we pursued together two wolves.You bowed to me, and said that I was dexterous.

passages.zh: 俟我於著乎而、充耳以素乎而、尚之以瓊華乎而。
passages.en: He was waiting for me between the door and the screen.The strings of his ear-stoppers were of white silk,And there were appended to them beautiful Hua-stones.

passages.zh: 俟我於庭乎而、充耳以青乎而、尚之以瓊瑩乎而。
passages.en: He was waiting for me in the open court.The strings of his ear-stoppers were of green silk,And there were appended to them beautiful Ying-stones.

passages.zh: 俟我於堂乎而、充耳以黃乎而、尚之以瓊英乎而。
passages.en: He was waiting for me in the hall.The strings of his ear-stoppers were of yellow silk,And there were appended to them beautiful Ying-stones.

passages.zh: 東方之日兮。彼姝者子、在我室兮。在我室兮、履我即兮。
passages.en: The sun is in the east,And that lovely girl,Is in my chamber.She is in my chamber;She treads in my footsteps, and comes to me.

passages.zh: 東方之月兮。彼姝者子、在我闥兮。在我闥兮、履我發兮。
passages.en: The moon is in the east,And that lovely girl,Is inside my door.She is inside my door;She treads in my footsteps, and hastens away.

passages.zh: 東方未明、顛倒衣裳。顛之倒之、自公召之。
passages.en: Before the east was bright,I was putting on my clothes upside down;I was putting them on upside down,And there was one from the court calling me.

passages.zh: 東方未晞、顛倒裳衣。倒之顛之、自公令之。
passages.en: Before there was a streak of dawn in the east,I was putting on my clothes upside down;I was putting them on upside down,And there was one from the court with orders for me.

passages.zh: 折柳樊圃、狂夫瞿瞿。不能辰夜、不夙則莫。
passages.en: You fence your garden with branches of willow,And the reckless fellows stand in awe.He, [however], cannot fix the time of night;If he be not too early, he is sure to be late.

passages.zh: 南山崔崔、雄狐綏綏。魯道有蕩、齊子由歸。既曰歸止、曷又懷止。
passages.en: High and large is the south hill,And a male fox is on it, solitary and suspicious.The way to Lu is easy and plain,And the daughter of Qi went by it to her husband's.Since she went to her husband's,Why do you further think of her?

passages.zh: 葛屨五兩、冠緌雙止。魯道有蕩、齊子庸止。既曰庸止、曷又從止。
passages.en: The five kinds of dolichos shoes are [made] in pairs,And the string-ends of a cap are made to match;The way to Lu is easy and plain,And the daughter of Qi travelled it.Since she travelled it,Why do you still follow her?

passages.zh: 蓺麻如之何、衡從其畝。取妻如之何、必告父母。既曰告止、曷又鞠止。
passages.en: How do we proceed in planting hemp?The acres must be dressed lengthwise and crosswise.How do we proceed in taking a wife?Announcement must first be made to our parents.Since such announcement was made,Why do you still indulge her desires?

passages.zh: 析薪如之何、匪斧不克。取妻如之何、匪媒不得。既曰得止、曷又極止。
passages.en: How do we proceed in splitting firewood?Without an axe it cannot be done.How do we proceed in taking a wife?Without a go-between it cannot be done.Since this was done,Why do you still allow her to go to this extreme?

passages.zh: 無田甫田、維莠驕驕。無思遠人、勞心忉忉。
passages.en: Do not try to cultivate fields too large; -The weeds will only grow luxuriantly.Do not think of winning people far away; -Your toiling heart will be grieved.

passages.zh: 無田甫田、維莠桀桀。無思遠人、勞心怛怛。
passages.en: Do not try to cultivate fields too large; -The weeds will only grow proudly.Do not think of winning people far away; -Your toiling heart will be distressed.

passages.zh: 婉兮孌兮、總角丱兮。未幾見兮、突而弁兮。
passages.en: How young and tender,Is the child with his two tufts of hair!When you see him after not a long time,Lo! he is wearing the cap!

passages.zh: 盧令令、其人美且仁。
passages.en: Ling-ling go the hounds; -Their master is admirable and kind.

passages.zh: 盧重環、其人美且鬈。
passages.en: There go the hounds with their double rings; -Their master is admirable and good.

passages.zh: 盧重鋂、其人美且偲。
passages.en: There go the hounds with their triple rings; -Their master is admirable and able.

passages.zh: 敝笱在梁、其魚魴鰥。齊子歸止、其從如雲。
passages.en: Worn out is the basket at the dam,And the fishes are the bream and the Guan,The daughter of Qi has returned,With a cloud of attendants.

passages.zh: 敝笱在梁、其魚魴鱮。齊子歸止、其從如雨。
passages.en: Worn out is the basket at the dam,And the fishes are the bream and the tench,The daughter of Qi has returned,With a shower of attendants.

passages.zh: 敝笱在梁、其魚唯唯。齊子歸止、其從如水。
passages.en: Worn out is the basket at the dam,And the fishes go in and out freely,The daughter of Qi has returned,With a stream of attendants.

passages.zh: 載驅薄薄、簟茀朱鞹。魯道有蕩、齊子發夕。
passages.en: She urges on her chariot rapidly,With its screen of bamboos woven in squares, and its vermilion coloured leather.The way from Lu is easy and plain,And the daughter of Qi started on it in the evening.

passages.zh: 四驪濟濟、垂轡濔濔。魯道有蕩、齊子豈弟。
passages.en: Her four black horses are beautiful,And soft look the reins as they hang.The way from Lu is easy and plain,And the daughter of Qi is delighted and complacent.

passages.zh: 汶水湯湯、行人彭彭。魯道有蕩、齊子翱翔。
passages.en: The waters of the Wen flow broadly on;The travellers are numerous.The way from Lu is easy and plain,And the daughter of Qi moves on with unconcern.

passages.zh: 汶水滔滔、行人儦儦。魯道有蕩、齊子遊遨。
passages.en: The waters of the Wen sweep on;The travellers are in crowds.The way from Lu is easy and plain,And the daughter of Qi proceeds at her ease.

passages.zh: 猗嗟昌兮、頎而長兮、抑若揚兮、美目揚兮。巧趨蹌兮、射則臧兮。
passages.en: Alas for him, so handsome and accomplished!How grandly tall!With what elegance in his high forehead!With what motion of his beautiful eyes!With what skill in the swift movements of his feet!With what mastery of archery!

passages.zh: 猗嗟名兮、美目清兮。儀既成兮。終日射侯、不出正兮。展我甥兮。
passages.en: Alas for him, so famous!His beautiful eyes how clear!His manners how complete!Shooting all day at the target,And never lodging outside the bird-square!Indeed our [ruler's] nephew!

passages.zh: 猗嗟孌兮、清揚婉兮。舞則選兮、射則貫兮。四矢反兮、以禦亂兮。
passages.en: Alas for him, so beautiful!His bright eyes and high forehead how lovely!His dancing so choice!Sure to send his arrows right through!The four all going to the same place!One able to withstand rebellion!

passages.zh: 蟋蟀在堂、歲聿其莫。今我不樂、日月其除。無已大康、職思其居。好樂無荒、良士瞿瞿。
passages.en: The cricket is in the hall,And the year is drawing to a close.If we do not enjoy ourselves now,The days and months will be leaving us.But let us not go to great excess;Let us first think of the duties of our position;Let us not be wild in our love of enjoyment.The good man is anxiously thoughtful.

passages.zh: 蟋蟀在堂、歲聿其逝。今我不樂、日月其邁。無已大康、職思其外。好樂無荒、良士蹶蹶。
passages.en: The cricket is in the hall,And the year is passing away.If we do not enjoy ourselves now,The days and months will have gone.But let us not go to great excess;Let us first send our thoughts beyond the present;Let us not be wild in our love of enjoyment.The good man is ever diligent.

passages.zh: 蟋蟀在堂、役車其休。今我不樂、日月其慆。無已大康、職思其憂。好樂無荒、良士休休。
passages.en: The cricket is in the hall,And our carts stand unemployed.If we do not enjoy ourselves now,The days and months will have gone by.But let us not go to an excess;Let us first think of the griefs that may arise;Let us not be wild in our love of enjoyment.The good man is quiet and serene.

passages.zh: 山有樞、隰有榆。子有衣裳、弗曳弗婁。子有車馬、弗馳弗驅。宛其死矣、他人是愉。
passages.en: On the mountains are the thorny elms,In the low, wet grounds are the white elms.You have suits of robes,But you will not wear them;You have carriages and horses,But you will not drive them.You will drop off in death,And another person will enjoy them.

passages.zh: 山有栲、隰有杻。子有廷內、弗洒弗埽。子有鐘鼓、弗鼓弗考。宛其死矣、他人是保。
passages.en: On the mountains is the Kao,In the low wet grounds is the Niu.You have courtyards and inner rooms,But you will not have them sprinkled or swept;You have drums and bells,But you will not have them beat or struck,You will drop off in death,And another person will possess them.

passages.zh: 山有漆、隰有栗。子有酒食、何不日鼓瑟。且以喜樂、且以永日。宛其死矣、他人入室。
passages.en: On the mountains are the varnish trees,In the low wet grounds are the chestnuts.You have spirits and viands; -Why not daily play your lute?Both to give a zest to your joy,And to prolong the day?You will drop off in death,And another person will enter your chamber.

passages.zh: 揚之水、白石鑿鑿。素衣朱襮、從子于沃。既見君子、云何不樂。
passages.en: Amidst the fretted waters,The white rocks stand up grandly.Bringing a robe of white silk, with a vermillion collar,We will follow you to Wo.When we have seen the princely lord,Shall we not rejoice?

passages.zh: 揚之水、白石皓皓。素衣朱繡、從子于鵠。既見君子、云何其憂。
passages.en: Amidst the fretted waters,The white rocks stand glistening.Bringing a robe of white silk, with a vermillion collar, and embroidered,We will follow you to Hu.When we have seen the princely lord,What sorrow will remain to us?

passages.zh: 揚之水、白石粼粼。我聞有命、不敢以告人。
passages.en: Amidst the fretted waters,The white rocks clearly show.We have heard your orders,And will not dare to inform any one of them.

passages.zh: 椒聊之實、蕃衍盈升。彼其之子、碩大無朋。椒聊且、遠條且。
passages.en: The clusters of the pepper plant,Large and luxuriant, would fill a pint.That hero thereIs large and peerless.O the pepper plant!How its shoots extend!

passages.zh: 椒聊之實、蕃衍盈匊。彼其之子、碩大且篤。椒聊且、遠條且。
passages.en: The clusters of the pepper plant,Large and luxuriant, would fill both your hands.That hero thereIs large and generous.O the pepper plant!How its shoots extend!

passages.zh: 綢繆束薪、三星在天。今夕何夕、見此良人。子兮子兮、如此良人何。
passages.en: Round and round the firewood is bound;And the Three Stars appear in the sky.This evening is what evening,That I see this good man?O me! O me!That I should get a good man like this!

passages.zh: 綢繆束芻、三星在隅。今夕何夕、見此邂逅。子兮子兮、如此邂逅何。
passages.en: Round and round the grass is bound;And the Three Stars are seen from the corner.This evening is what evening,That we have this unexpected meeting?Happy pair! Happy pair!That we should have this unexpected meeting!

passages.zh: 綢繆束楚、三星在戶。今夕何夕、見此粲者。子兮子兮、如此粲者何。
passages.en: Round and round the thorns are bound;And the Three Stars are seen from the door.This evening is what evening,That I see this beauty?O me! O me!That I should see a beauty like this!

passages.zh: 有杕之杜、其葉湑湑。獨行踽踽。豈無他人、不如我同父。嗟行之人、胡不比焉。人無兄弟、胡不佽焉。
passages.en: There is a solitary russet pear tree,[But] its leaves are luxuriant.Alone I walk unbefriended; -Is it because there are no other people?But none are like the sons of one's father.O ye travellers,Why do ye not sympathize with me?Without brothers as I am,Why do ye not help me?

passages.zh: 有杕之杜、其葉菁菁。獨行睘睘。豈無他人、不如我同姓。嗟行之人、胡不比焉。人無兄弟、胡不佽焉。
passages.en: There is a solitary russet pear tree,[But] its leaves are abundant.Alone I walk uncared for; -Is it that there are not other people?But none are like those of one's own surname.O ye travellers,Why do ye not sympathize with me?Without brothers as I am,Why do ye not help me?

passages.zh: 羔裘豹袪、自我人居居。豈無他人、維子之故。
passages.en: Lamb's fur and leopard's cuffs,You use us with unkindness.Might we not find another chief?But [we stay] because of your forefathers.

passages.zh: 羔裘豹褎、自我人究究。豈無他人、維子之好。
passages.en: Lamb's fur and leopard's cuffs,You use us with cruel unkindness.Might we not find another chief?But [we stay] from our regard to you.

passages.zh: 肅肅鴇羽、集于苞栩。王事靡盬、不能蓺稷黍、父母何怙。悠悠蒼天、曷其有所。
passages.en: Su-su go the feathers of the wild geese,As they settle on the bushy oaks.The king's affairs must not be slackly discharged,And [so] we cannot plant our sacrificial millet and millet; -What will our parents have to rely on?O thou distant and azure Heaven!When shall we be in our places again?

passages.zh: 肅肅鴇翼、集于苞棘。王事靡盬、不能蓺黍稷、父母何食。悠悠蒼天、曷其有極。
passages.en: Su-su go the wings of the wild geese,As they settle on the bushy jujube trees.The king's affairs must not be slackly discharged,And [so] we cannot plant our millet and sacrificial millet; -How shall our parents be supplied with food?O thou distant and azure Heaven!When shall [our service] have an end?

passages.zh: 肅肅鴇行、集于苞桑。王事靡盬、不能蓺稻粱、父母何嘗。悠悠蒼天、曷其有常。
passages.en: Su-su go the rows of the wild geese,As they rest on the bushy mulberry trees.The king's business must not be slackly discharged,And [so] we cannot plant our rice and maize; -How shalll our parents get food?O thou distant and azure Heaven!When shall we get [back] to our ordinary lot?

passages.zh: 豈曰無衣七兮、不如子之衣、安且吉兮。
passages.en: How can it be said that he is without robes?He has those of the seven orders;But it is better that he get those robes from you.That will secure tranquillity and good fortune.

passages.zh: 豈曰無衣六兮、不如子之衣、安且燠兮。
passages.en: How can it be said that he is without robes?He has those of the six orders;But it is better that he get those robes from you.That will secure tranquillity and permanence.

passages.zh: 有杕之杜、生于道左。彼君子兮、噬肯適我。中心好之、曷飲食之。
passages.en: There is a solitary russet pear tree,Growing on the left of the way.That princely man there!He might be willing to come to me.In the centre of my heart I love him,[But] how shall I supply him with drink and food?

passages.zh: 有杕之杜、生于道周。彼君子兮、噬肯來遊。中心好之、曷飲食之。
passages.en: There is a solitary russet pear tree,Growing where the way makes a compass.That princely man there!He might be willing to come and ramble [with me].In the centre of my heart I love him,[But] how shall I supply him with drink and food?

passages.zh: 葛生蒙楚、蘞蔓于野。予美亡此、誰與獨處。
passages.en: The dolichos grows, covering the thorn trees;The convolvulus spreads all over the waste.The man of my admiration is no more here;With whom can I dwell? - I abide alone.

passages.zh: 葛生蒙棘、蘞蔓于域。予美亡此、誰與獨息。
passages.en: The dolichos grows, covering the jujube trees;The convolvulus spreads all over the tombs.The man of my admiration is no more here;With whom can I dwell? - I rest alone.

passages.zh: 角枕粲兮、錦衾爛兮。予美亡此、誰與獨旦。
passages.en: How beautiful was the pillow of horn!How splendid was the embroidered coverlet!The man of my admiration is no more here; -With whom can I dwell? - Alone [I wait for] the morning.

passages.zh: 夏之日、冬之夜、百歲之後、歸於其居。
passages.en: Through the [long] days of summer,Through the [long] nights of winter [shall I be alone],Till the lapse of a hundred years,When I shall go home to his abode.

passages.zh: 冬之夜、夏之日、百歲之後、歸於其室。
passages.en: Through the [long] nights of winter,Through the [long] days of summer [shall I be alone],Till the lapse of a hundred years,When I shall go home to his chamber.

passages.zh: 采苓采苓、首陽之巔。人之為言、苟亦無信。舍旃舍旃、苟亦無然。人之為言、胡得焉。
passages.en: Would you gather the liquorice, would you gather the liquorice,On the top of Shouyang?When men tell their stories,Do not readily believe them;Put them aside, put them aside.Do not readily assent to them;And, when men tell their stories,How will they find course?

passages.zh: 采苦采苦、首陽之下。人之為言、苟亦無與。舍旃舍旃、苟亦無然。人之為言、胡得焉。
passages.en: Would you gather the sowthistle, would you gather the sowthistle,At the foot of Shouyang?When men tell their stories,Do not readily approve them;Put them aside, put them aside.Do not readily assent to them;And, when men tell their stories,How will they find course?

passages.zh: 采葑采葑、首陽之東。人之為言、苟亦無從。舍旃舍旃、苟亦無然。人之為言、胡得焉。
passages.en: Would you gather the mustard plant, would you gather the mustard plant,On the east of Shouyang?When men tell their stories,Do not readily listen to them; -Put them aside, put them aside.Do not readily assent to them;And, when men tell their stories,How will they find course?

passages.zh: 有車鄰鄰、有馬白顛。未見君子、寺人之令。
passages.en: He has many carriages, giving forth their lin-lin;He has horses with their white foreheads.Before we can see our prince,We must get the services of the eunuch.

passages.zh: 阪有漆、隰有栗。既見君子、並坐鼓瑟。今者不樂、逝者其耋。
passages.en: On the hill-sides are varnish trees;In the low wet grounds are chestnuts.When we have seen our prince,We sit together with him, and they play on their lutes.If now we do not take our joy,The time will pass till we are octogenarians.

passages.zh: 阪有桑、隰有楊。既見君子、並坐鼓簧。今者不樂、逝者其亡。
passages.en: On the hill-sides are mulberry trees;In the low wet grounds are willows.When we have seen our prince,We sit together with him, and they play on their organs.If now we do not take our joy,The time will pass till we are no more.

passages.zh: 駟驖孔阜、六轡在手。公之媚子、從公于狩。
passages.en: His four iron-black horses are in very fine condition;The six reins are in the hand [of the charioteer].The ruler's favourites,Follow him to the chase.

passages.zh: 奉時辰牡、辰牡孔碩。公曰左之、舍拔則獲。
passages.en: The male animals of the season are made to present themselves,The males in season, of very large size.The ruler says, ' To the left of them; 'Then he lets go his arrows and hits.

passages.zh: 遊于北園、四馬既閑。輶車鸞鑣、載獫歇驕。
passages.en: He rambles in the northern park;His four horses display their training.Light carriages, with bells at the horses' bits,Convey the long and short-mouthed dogs.

passages.zh: 小戎俴收、五楘梁輈。游環脅驅、陰靷鋈續、文茵暢轂、駕我騏馵。言念君子、溫其如玉。在其板屋、亂我心曲。
passages.en: [There is] his short war carriage; -With the ridge-like end of its pole, elegantly bound in five places;With its slip rings and side straps,And the traces attached by gilt rings to the masked transverse;With its beautiful mat of tiger's skin, and its long naves;With its piebalds, and horses with white left feet.When I think of my husband [thus],Looking bland and soft as a piece of jade;Living there in his plank house;It sends confusion into all the corners of my heart.

passages.zh: 四牡孔阜、六轡在手、騏駵是中、騧驪是驂、龍盾之合、鋈以觼軜。言念君子、溫其在邑。方何為期、胡然我念之。
passages.en: His four horses are in very fine condition,And the six reins are in the hand [of the charioteer].Piebald, and bay with black mane, are the insides;Yellow with black mouth, and black, are the outsides;Side by side are placed the dragon-figured shields;Gilt are the buckles for the inner reins.I think of my husband [thus],Looking so mild in the cities there.What time can be fixed for his return?Oh! how I think of him!

passages.zh: 俴駟孔羣、厹矛鋈錞、蒙伐有苑、虎韔鏤膺、交韔二弓、竹閉緄縢。言念君子、載寢載興。厭厭良人、秩秩德音。
